Articles.Content: Calling 911 because you have been hexed.
Calling 911 from the Hexen level.
Calling 911 because the Grimm married the Hexen Beast.
Calling 911 because Korax and D'Sparil are at your doors.
Calling 911 to get the Lorax to come back.
Calling 911 because the Lorax has come back.
Calling 911 to get advice on moustache grooming.

Calling 911 to ask if they deliver catnip

064806042024
Calling 911 to say that you already bought dthe liver cat nip.
Calling 911 to talk about the thing I can't talk about.
Calling 911 just from soft skills.
Calling 911 because your Teddy Bear needs sewing.
Calling 911 because this Teddy Bear appears to be a larva of Yao Guai.
Calling 911 because life is un-teddy-bearable.
Calling 911 because the neighbours are a mere quarter-decibel above what you call "comfortable"
Calling 911 because we only ever seem to play De_Dust2.
Calling 911 to get an aquatic car.
Calling 911 because your search for an amphibious car turns up the Aqua Car...which is just a regular two-seater car with a radio that only ever plays Barbie Girl.
Calling 911 to get a banana from the grocery store
Calling 911 to ask for support for my table-top role-play system's Kickstarter.
Calling 911 to find how to animate your own lights.
Calling 911 because it's half an hour to official release and your game with a number of selectable stages doesn't have a stage select option in it.
Calling 911 to release your tension.

Calling 911 because I've just been told that fish don't exist.

(Operator: "Just ignore it. They classify and re-classify stuff all the time. It'll pass.")
Calling 911 to ask where all the game players have gone?
